result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brent Tyler Huff

records.addlTxt:
Asst. District Attorney Kevin Greene appears on behalf of the State. Defendant Brent Tyler Huff in court.  Attorney Jason Robert Farris in court for Brent Tyler Huff. Present bond continued
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Asst. District Attorney Kari Hoffman appears on behalf of the State via Zoom. Attorney Jason Robert Farris appears via Zoom. Brent Tyler Huff appears in court. Court modifies signature bond to allow defendant out of his residence for employment purposes. Defendant to provide verification to CJS beforehand. All other conditions remain.

ADDRESS INFO for Brent Tyler Huff
Current: 165 E Pulaski St #204, Pulaski, WI 54162 United States  (Effective: 09-30-2022)
Prior: 1216 Chief Hill Drive, Green Bay, WI 54313

Defendant to report to CJS within 24 hours of court or release from custody.
Absolute Sobriety.
Defendant to live with mother at 165 E. Pulaski St. #204 unless at a treatment program. Defendant must be at the residence from 8:00 p.m. - 6:00 a.m.
Defendant to report to Oneida Behavioral Health by 10:00 a.m. on 6/15/22.
Defendant allowed to be out of his residence for employment purposes. Defendant to provide verification to CJS beforehand.
Bail/bond hearing on September 30, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Conditions of Bail

Assistant District Attorney Aaron Linssen appears on behalf of the State. Attorney Jason Robert Farris appears via Zoom. Brent Tyler Huff does not appear as he is in treatment. Present bond continued
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to report to CJS within 24 hours of court or release from custody.
Absolute Sobriety.
Defendant to live with mother at 165 E. Pulaski St. #204 unless at a treatment program. Defendant must be at the residence from 8:00 p.m. - 6:00 a.m.
Defendant to report to Oneida Behavioral Health by 10:00 a.m. on 6/15/22.

Assistant District Attorney Meranda Hillmann appears on behalf of the State. Defendant Brent Tyler Huff in court.  Attorney Jason Robert Farris and Brent Tyler Huff appear via Zoom. Defendant Brent Huff in custody. Defendant pleads not guilty to all counts. Court orders $5,000.00 signature bond with added conditions. All other prior conditions remain.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brent Tyler Huff in court with attorney Jason Robert Farris.  Defendant Brent Tyler Huff in custody.  Assistant District Attorney J. Foss Davis appears on behalf of the State.  
Defendant/attorney waives right to Preliminary Hearing and files waiver form with Court.
Plea negotiations placed on the record.
Court accepts waiver/finds probable cause and orders defendant bound over to assigned branch.
Information to be filed.
Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
